The ecotone serves as a bridge between the two biomes, allowing species to move between them and creating a unique and diverse ecosystem.

 A. distance decay 
 B. friction of distance 
 C. relative distance 
 D. space-time compression 
 E. Tobler's law [/INST] </s>
pred:
#E. Tobler's law.

Tobler's law, also known as the law of geographic interaction, states that the distance between two places has an inverse relationship with the strength of their interaction. In other words, the farther apart two places are, the weaker their interaction will be. This law was first proposed by Waldo Tobler in 1970 and has since been widely applied in the field of geography and spatial analysis.
